description:
This is a simple racing game for children based on Walt Disney's 1950 animated film "Cinderella." The multicolor gameboard includes a folding card backdrop with the game's title and movie characters, which creates an effect similar to a stage.

Each player choose a pair of colored metal slipper tokens. Then, one of each pair is dropped into a bag and placed at the race's end (the castle). Progress is determined by drawing character cards that tell how many spaces to move, with each player moving using their remaining slipper. The player who gets to the castle first chooses a slipper randomly from the bag and if it matches theirs, they win the game and become Cinderella. If not, they go back and start the race again from the middle of the game track.

—user summary

Dive into the Dark World of the Brothers Grimm!

In Grimm World, you enter a dark world inspired by the fairy tales of the Brothers Grimm. You don't take on the role of a shining hero, but that of a simple citizen who wants to escape from his dreary everyday life. During your adventure, you will explore abandoned ruins, roam through dark forests, drink mead in dubious taverns and hunt wild creatures. Your decisions influence the entire game world, and random events, quests and rumors ensure that each campaign is unique.

Key Features:
Open World: Explore a dark world of fairy tales and legends inspired by the Brothers Grimm.
Tactical Combat: Compete against fairy tale characters in dungeon crawler-inspired battles using a unique action-reaction combat system.
Story-Driven Gameplay: Your decisions have far-reaching and lasting consequences in the game world. Will you save a village or help burn it down?
Character Development: Use two multi-level skill trees and over 30 different pieces of equipment to customize your character to your liking.
Alignment: Your actions in the game alter your character’s alignment. Will you become a merciless murderer or a shining hero? In Grimm World, anything is possible.
Unique Time System: Every action in the game consumes time. While you’re enjoying another mug of mead in a tavern, elsewhere, an unfortunate grandmother might be devoured by a wolf.
Playtime: Each campaign lasts 10-20 hours, and no two playthroughs are the same.
Simple Save System: After each game round, you can save within 5 minutes by stacking the cards in a predetermined order.

—description from the designer

The Little Mermaid is a flip & write game inspired by the famous fairy tale by Hans Christian Andersen.

Flip cards and cross out 1-3 adjacent animals in the underwater world but watch out because incomplete polyominos will score you negative points at the end. Complete rows and you will get a bonus power.

About the fairy tale:
The Little Mermaid lives together with her five sisters. The youngest and most curious amongst her siblings, she explores the underwater world. Yet life beneath the sea isn't enough for her. When she falls in love with a shipwrecked prince, she makes a deal with the evil witch. She trades her voice for legs, in an attempt to win the prince's everlasting love.

—description from the publisher

The Snow Queen is a card game inspired by the famous fairy tale by Hans Christian Andersen.

Push your luck to win the best friendship cards but be careful not to reach 10 in a colour that will cause you to bust. The question is simple: Take a card or stop? The set of friendship cards on offer changes every round so the challenge is knowing when to take the card and when to stop.

About the fairy tale:
The Snow Queen has frozen Kay's heart. His best friend Gerda embarks on a long journey to save their friendship while there is still time. She travels across mountains, snow covered forests and frozen lakes towards the cold north, before finally lifting the Snow Queen's curse and proving that friendship conquers all.

The Tinderbox is a card game inspired by the famous fairy tale by Hans Christian Andersen.

Play cards simultaneously and reveal them to see what treasures you got this round. You want the most valuable but too much of a good thing might leave you with a bitter taste and zero points.

About the fairy tale:
Heading home the soldier meets a witch that offers him gold and silver coins, if he climbs into a hollow tree and gets a Tinderbox for her. The soldier is greedy and also claims the Tinderbox. Later he discovers its power to call upon the dogs with huge eyes. With his new found power the soldier attempts to win the princess and the entire kingdom.

—description from the publisher

A terrible thing happened: a global catastrophe, the end of the world, the apocalypse - as you like. In order to survive, you urgently need to get into the bunker, but there are too many people in your group, there is not enough food or space for everyone inside. So someone will have to stay outside and try to survive there. You do not want to wander through the poisoned wastelands in search of a sip of water, which may also be poisoned or radioactive? Then try to convince the others that they can't survive without you! Only the most useful members of the group will get inside. You get a random set of cards that determines your gender, age, health, profession and other traits, and your task is to convince others that this set of characteristics is very, very effective. How do you convince others that your homeopathic hobby will benefit them? Try it and find out, and at the same time pump the skill of public speaking!

With MicroMacro: Crime City – All In, the next district of the crime-ridden black-and-white metropolis Crime City now opens up for the players. On a new, huge city map, which seamlessly follows the previous plans, 16 tricky crime cases are again waiting to be solved by one to four amateur detectives. These are brand new stories, more sophisticated and criminal than ever before! The aim is to determine motives, find evidence and convict the perpetrators. An attentive eye is just as much in demand as creative powers of deduction to unravel everything on the 75 x 110 cm game board. As a little help, a magnifying glass is included in the game and the individual cases are again marked with symbols, so that parents can decide which cases even the youngest investigators may investigate and uncover. MicroMacro: Crime City 3 - All In can be played completely independently, no previous knowledge from the other two parts is required.

—description from the publisher
Humans have invaded Mars, but Martians aren't going down without a fight! Each player chooses a deck and issues orders to their troops to break through the other player's defenses and win the game.

Ð¡ÐºÐ°Ð·Ð°Ð½Ð¸Ðµ ("Skazanie") is a fast and dynamic game for 2-4 players. It is easy to learn and explain. This game will take its players on a journey through the ancient Slavic lands and ages long-past, and show them a world of powerful gods, mythical creatures and omens.
The game is played by drawing battle cards and magical cards. Each round consists of rolling a die to determine the player's strength and then playing a battle card, which adds even more strength to the die. Magical cards are utilised to further enhance a player's strength, or to affect negatively the opponent/opponents. The winner of the round is the player with the highest strength after each player has chosen their battle card and magical cards. The game ends when there are no cards left in the drawing piles. The player with the highest score (most rounds won) is considered the winner.

In 1-Card Joust two knights will compete against each other in a joust to see who can either unhorse his opponent or break three lances to win the Joust. Each player will roll dice to determine how many actions they have. They will manipulate the dice by using Yahtzee style combos to increase their number of actions. With these actions they will try to increase their horse speed, maneuver their shield position or correct their lance position while trying to affect their opponents actions.

—description from the designer

Anglo-Zulu War game battle collection with twelve different scenarios.   The combat system is a version of other games by Bill Molyneaux’s games Bloody Mohawk, Savage Wilderness.  The game box will include Isandlwana, Rorkes Drift and other exciting scenarios. 
The scenario list is as follows: Sihayo’s Kraal, Isandlwana, Rorke’s Drift, iNyezane River, Intombi Drift, Ulundi, Ulundi Ambush, Hlobane, Kambula, Buller’s Pursuit, Gingindlovu, Prince Imperial.

—description from the designer

This is a simple spin-and-move game which, like the famous "Mansion of Happiness," adapts the basic format of the 63-space Game of Goose to an Americanized morality theme: in this case, ascending to the American presidency through government. Green spaces are blanks, but white spaces provide some positive or negative quality or trait: "Patriotism," "Firmness," "Hypocrisy," "Duplicity," and so on. An accompanying rulebook provides instructions for most of these spaces, which usually involve advancing or retreating to another space or losing a certain number of turns.

Colored counters (discs) and an 8-sided teetotum are also included.

At the beginning of 1793, after the execution of King Louis XVI, France was drawn into a war against a coalition of most European monarchies. On 24 February, the National Convention decreed the mass draft of 300,000 men to defend the eastern borders. Throughout the country, revolts broke out against this conscription, everywhere they were brutally repressed with success. However, an insurgent territory, called the "Vendée Militaire" resisted. Determined to engage in a trial of strength with the new revolutionary regime, the Vendéens gradually organised themselves until they formed a "Catholic and Royal Army".

Vendée 93, a card driven two player wargame, takes you back to this particularly epic period in the French history, which pitted the young French Republic against the Royalist insurgents from March to October 1793.

"White" or "Blue", choose your cause and take command of your troops!
"White": you will have to take the advantage quickly at the risk of seeing the Republican forces inexorably strengthen, forcing you into a sinister "Virée de Galerne".
"Blues": time is on your side, resist the first assaults of the "brigands" to then be able to face the hell of the bocage in order to definitively extinguish the insurrection.

—description from the publisher

You are one of the sons of Halach Uinic -the leader of the village-, who has inherited one of his father's lands. Now, you will try to manage the resources that the gods will give you in the dice you roll, with the objective of constructing buildings that will allow you to make the most outstanding and prosperous of all the Mayan cities by their imposing constructions, their spiritual influence, the priests established in your village, and the power of food production that your fields can generate.

In Mayan Be'et the initial player will roll 6 dice, take one, perform his actions considering 6 dice results, while the rest of the players at the same time will use the remaining 5 dice results to build imposing buildings, send to sacrifice, harvest or study their workers, exchange or reserve resources and send torrential rains to your rivals.

Each of these actions will earn you victory points, and the son whose village generates the most points will be Halach Uinic's favorite!

-description from designer

Don't follow me. Eight tried. Eight died.
-Z

The note is small, the script neat and angular. Unhurried, confident, just like it’s mysterious author. No signature, just a flourishing letter Z. But the message is clear. To follow would be to flirt with fate itself.

The Foxthief has no idea of the value of the stone they stole. It is the only thing that has kept Azulea calm. Now, the ground beneath you is rumbling. You vow to recover the Stone of Azulea, before she awakes completely and unleashes her wrath on your little village.

Unsure of how long your journey will be, or what dangers await you, you gather some provisions and embark on your quest.

When you return, you’ll be a legend.

...that is, if you return at all.

Objective

Haphazard is an addicting, grid-based dungeon crawler, complete with dramatized story (optional) to make your adventures come alive. Take on the role of a woodland creature and embark on a quest to find the Stone of Azulea before the mountain erupts destroying everything and everyone you’ve ever known.

For your family, your friends, your homes, and your honor!

Gameplay can be divided into 3 main phases


     Create- fill in your labyrinth for your rival to solve. Add some monsters and locks and gold based on the map's legend.
     Explore- move, collect gold, fight lurkers, pick locks, and find the exit.
     Upgrade- record your renown, buy boosts, heal up, and prepare for the next level.


Each time you begin a level, you will listen to a dramatized story. When you fight certain monsters or encounter certain locks, the player sheet will instruct you to listen to another entry in the story.

Haphazard: Azulea Awakens
Navigate labyrinths, fight ferocious lurkers, discover shiny treasures, upgrade your character, and make a name for yourself... if you ever make it out.

—description from the publisher

A quiz game about the swedish national football team.
Contains 60 questions and a category tile to make this an expansion for the big Bezzerwizzer games.

The Game of Quizzer Questionnaire is a questionnaire game from Stoll & Edwards, basically a precursor to such titles as Trivial Pursuit. Players use a spinner to randomly select a question from an included book that pertains to geography, history, government, science, or "every day facts of interest." The game book is advertised as including "Over 1,000 Questions and Answers."

The game also includes a box of colored chits, called "Pawns," that are used to cover spaces on a tile and thus show a player's progress toward winning.

—user summary

Clackerjack is a climbing game that is played with two sets of double-six dominoes. It can be played by four players, in fixed partnerships, or by two players, in a head-to-head duel.

The blank tiles, which are all wilds, get distributed equitably between the two sides; each player then draws their own hand of tiles from the boneyard. The goal is to ditch all of these dominoes through the skillful play of combinations and bombs.

Lots of bombs.

Welcome to the tournament of the best voices of fairy kingdoms! Here you will become minstrels composing songs about precedented and unprecedented feats of heroes — be it noble robbers, wise wizards, greedy dragons, valiant knights or beautiful princesses!

ÐœÐµÐ½ÐµÑÑ‚Ñ€ÐµÐ»Ð¸ (Minstrels) is a roll-and-place game. Each player receives his own game board, on which he will place wooden figures of heroes and combine them. Gameplay is fast and simple: each round 2 dice are rolled and two numbers are shown, which simultaneously corresponds a place on game board where a figure of hero can be placed, and the type of a figure. Starting with the first player, all players take turns and choose individually for himself which one die will indicate the place on game board, and which die will indicate the figure of hero. In addition, a player can change numbers on dices individually for himself by paying coins.

Adapt to rolled result or change it with coins and collect the most profitable combinations, because correct arrangement of heroes in rows, columns, and cells corresponding to the quest card will bring you victory points! Player who gain most points will be winner and earn the title of the most talented minstrel who sang the best song!

In this deductive genre, each player plays the role of a character with the dual purpose of solving a mystery and simultaneously achieving their own goals. The investigation, the negotiations with the rest of the cast and the exchange of information are essential pieces to solve the crime, but do not forget that the murderer is one of you. You can't believe everything they tell you, but you can't take victory without trusting someone either...

The peaceful daily life of a remote village, in which legends about the existence of werewolves still survive, is disrupted when the body of a traveling merchant is discovered the day after the great celebration that has taken place in the town. The victim has been severely beaten, having had entire strands of hair pulled out and shows deep tears to his neck, just as one would expect from a werewolf attack. As if this wasn't alarming enough, two months ago the blacksmith's wife was murdered under identical circumstances.

Compete over ten rounds to claim victory in this fast paced trivia game.

One player hosts the game and everyone else battles it out. Each question has seven clues but only one right answer. The clues get easier, but the less you use, the more points you win! Any player can answer every question, so it's a race to react and slap the "go" card first.

How will you play? Go! for a high score, guess early, and risk crashing out of the round? Or Go! steady, use more clues and cunningly capture more points?

After the ten rounds whoever has the most points wins!

-description from publisher

The game is based on telling strange and bizarre stories, based on the cards that come out, corresponding to the questions: “where?”, “Who?”, “What?”, “To whom?”, “With what? " it's because?".

In O Homem Que Mordeu a Caderneta de Cromos, players set out in search of bizarre stories to tell when they land in the right house, and try to make their listeners laugh, so that they can earn prestigious coins. The possibilities are endless! Put creativity to the test and tell the best story!

The game takes place with the roll of a dice that moves us forward on the board. Through the house where we fall, we exchange our cards for others of the same color, changing the title of our bizarre news.
When we hit the "Está na Hora" house, we started to invent our story based on the title we were building in front of us.
We have time counted by an hourglass and if we get away with it within that time and we manage to convince the other players, we win a prestigious coin.
At the end of the game the player with the most prestigious coins wins.

It is the same game as O Homem que Mordeu o Cão but with a 70's/80's theme.

New Card Game.

Transparent and waterproof SHOOTHIT Playing Cards.

compound:

Complete set of 54 cards: 52 playing cards and 2 rule cards.

Game based on 4 different suits of 13 cards.

(Suits: Circle, Triangle, Penta, Square)

HOW PLAY

THE GAME
The game is very simple, if you know how to count you know how to play, you just have to add one.

After dealing all the cards that we cannot seen, each player reveals on his turn a card from his covered deck to his right. Witch he will try to mount to the central deck or mount on the other player or himself, if not, he leave the card on his right.

Creating like this on the right the undercover deck.

Ex: the 5 over the 4 (mounting in an always increasing way)

When a player draws an Ace, he leave the card on the center, creates the center deck and distributes a penalty to all players.Only in the central deck the numbers and ALSO the SUIT hve to be respected.

When the player place a card he have the right to reveal the next one.

ONLY 1 RULE: SHOOTHIT have only a important rule, and it's, you have to try to mount the cards already revealed  to your right before revealing another one.

And now you know how play SHOOTHIT!

The rules don't change but only the penalties according to the game mode.

Welcome to Absurdia! This card-based party game for 3-8 players will be sure to challenge you and your friends with absolutely absurd scenarios and arguments, with endless combinations of cards and infinite fun to be had! The goal of Absurdia is to be the first player to win 3 Question Cards. Two players face off each turn and play Hero and Support Cards that best answer the question. Each player gets 30 seconds to give their absurd argument as to why their cards answer the question better than their opponent's. The remainder of the group then votes on the winner, who wins the Question Card! The questions are ridiculous! The heroes are unlikely! The attributes are ludicrous! Get ready to flex your imagination and dive into the oddest of scenarios, because here at Absurdia we live by one motto:
It's time to get weird!

-description from publisher

Flags of all colors dance in the wind as Navirians converge to Trawl for the long-awaited Banner Festival.

Generate the most profits for your trading house by selling goods, befriending the right suppliers, and making bets at the watercraft race. Opportunities abound in the floating market, but only the keenest trader will prevail!


     Each turn, aim to play the highest, mid, or lowest Merchandise card to unlock different actions.
     Utilize multi-use cards in dynamic trick-taking bouts to gain an advantage over your rival merchants.
     There are numerous paths to victory, but reading your opponents and timing your moves is the key to success!


All set in the glorious world of Tidal Blades created by Mr. Cuddington.

—description from the publisher

Long ago the Gems of Power were weilded by Heroes and Wizards. Commanding and combining them to subdue the powers of evil, and drive them from the land. Over time the heroes vanished and the Wizards aged, and retired. The evil returned, hiding in the dark depths and causing havok among the lands above.

The Gems have been found again... it is time to purge the evil once again.

In Dungeon (squared) take on the role of one of four characters and face the challenges of a randomly created dungeon.

Brave heroes prepare yourselves for adventure....

—description from the publisher

In Blood of a King the object of the game is to wound your opponent's King 3 times. Each player starts with a deck of 12 cards, 10 Warrior cards numbered 0-9, 1 King card numbered 10, and 1 Witch card numbered 11. A round begins by each player dealing out five card onto the play surface from left to right. The cards have a silhouette of an Axe or a Shield along the long edge of the card. When the edges of the cards line up they will either match axes, shields, or have no match. The number of Axes is your attack strength, the number of shields your defense. If you have more Axes than you opponent has Shields, you have wounded their tribe. See what their highest numbered card is. If it is a Warrior, remove the card from play. If it is the King, give them one of your matching wound cards. If it is their Witch, remove their Witch from play, but also remove your lowest Warrior card.

If the initial draw of cards results in a tie, each player plays another card to the right of the last card played. Count Axes and Shields again, and follow the above results.

If your tribe is going to be wounded by your opponent you may CALL UPON THE BERSERKS! When you Call Upon The Berserks you may draw one card and play it to either end of your row of cards. You may do this only once per round and the Berserk card will be removed from play after the round.

Continue playing rounds until one player has received the three wound cards from their opponent.

—from the publisher

It's time for another Sushi Rush tournament!

Prepare your chopsticks and your determination to overcome your opponents in this game of dexterity, skill and delicious sushi. In each round, players will compete simultaneously in different game modes. Master the art of focus and efficiency to become the next Master Sushiman!

On each round, players will draw a card and compete to grab the right combination of sushi with their chopsticks. Each card feature a unique challenge, be it collecting sushis of the same flavor, shape or even stacking them to build the highest tower.

Players receive honor points depending on their success and the one with the most points at the end of the game becomes the next Master Sushiman.

-description from publisher

The baby is hungry! The first player to get to the Milk Man and then back home with a bottle of milk will win.

Fundamentally this is a movement game, using two traffic cop spinners that tell players how many spaces to move, what direction they can go, and whether or not they can turn. According to the All-Fair catalog, the game "teaches traffic rules with great gusto and lots of fun."

Players use little metal cars as tokens and are allowed to share spaces. Both the Milk Man and the Policeman (the entrance to Home) must be reached on exact spins.

The game was published with a double-sided board that has a checkerboard on the other side.

During the autumnal equinox, the elves compete to be the ones who bring the most apples to the village. They form teams in pairs and go into the forest to collect the apples.

They use ramps, platforms, traps and even magical portals and at nightfall they light a huge bonfire to carry out the apple ritual. The couple of elves that has collected the most apples will be the couple of the year!

Each player will try to make a way with cards (ramps, platforms, duplicators and magic portal) and the apples will fall in their baskets.

Play a card, draw a card... it´s simple!! Each card has a "maduration cost"... and when this track finish all the apples will fall. The players with more apples will win.

PREMIO CORONA LÚDICA MEJOR JUEGO FAMILIAR 2022 (Spain)

TúlélÅ‘k Viadala is an exciting quiz, trivia game in which survival is at stake. In a playful way, the game provides knowledge for solving unexpected situations that occur in everyday life, for which ordinary people may not be prepared.

During the game, you have to survive disaster situations hidden in the skin of different characters: in the event of a winter power outage lasting several days, after a plane crash in the jungle, or just during a zombie attack. In the first part of the game, the characters test their survival skills with quiz questions about emergencies and disasters. With correct answers, they get tools that they can use during the survival situation in the second part of the game. This is where the misfortune takes place, the stages of which can bring more and more plagues.

It’s the family favorite card game you love, now enhanced with the power of the Justice League! Players race to get rid of all their cards by matching a card in their hand with the current card shown on top of the deck.

There are two customizable cards and a special new wild card: the Superman X-Ray vision card! That card lets you look at any other player's cards and make strategic exchanges that pump up the excitement!

Score points by being the first to get rid of all the cards in your hand. First player or team to 500 wins. When you're down to one card, don't forget to yell "UNO!" Contains 112 cards plus instructions. For 2 to 10 players, ages 7 and older. Easy to pick up, impossible to put down.

—description from the publisher

Batman, Superman, Wonder Woman, The Flash, Green Lantern, and Martian Manhunter band together for this brand-new HeroClix starter set!

This boxed-set is a great way for 1 to 4 players to learn HeroClix! Play with the contents of this starter set or combine it with other HeroClix figures for even more fun!

This starter set contains everything up to 4 people need to play HeroClix.

—description from the publisher

Celebrate the release of DC Comics HeroClix: DC Rebirthwith a new Fast Forces set featuring the Justice League. DC Comics’ most powerful and prolific superhero team reunites with all-new dials and two never-before-clixed characters from the Justice League of China: Super-Man (Kenan Kong) and Bat-Man (Wang Baixi). In this Fast Forces, you will also find core Justice League characters like Aquaman, Cyborg, The Flash, and Wonder Woman!

—description from the publisher

With the 15th Anniversary of HeroClix, WizKids is excited to reveal DC heroes as seen in the pages of Elseworlds!

The DC Comics HeroClix: 15th Anniversary Elseworlds Starter Set includes the most iconic DC heroes. A great introduction to HeroClix for rookies, a useful teaching tool for experienced stores, and a fresh look at iconic characters for HeroClix veterans!

—description from the publisher

The horses are lined up and under Starter's Orders... and they're OFF!

Now all you can do is watch and shout encouragement as the mighty steeds thunder around the track, racing towards the finish line.  Will you have backed the winner?

In this game of nature & nurture, make your house beautiful by caring for your very own collection of houseplants! In this easy-to-learn board game, collect your favorite plants and then try to feed them every round with the right combination of light, water, and plant food.
 Planted features 42 varieties of popular and exotic houseplants, each with their own requirements to grow. Discover various planting tools and decorations to help you raise beautiful, thriving plants, and score bonus points.  The player, or plant parent, that ends up scoring the most points from growing their plants is declared the game’s biggest green thumb - and winner!

Some features:

     Easy to learn mechanics for all ages strategy
     Collect resource tokens to care for your nursery (water drop, sun chip, plant food, etc.)
     Features 42 popular and various plant varieties for all levels of plant parents including the fiddle leaf fig, philodendron, ZZ plant, monstera, croton, and more!
     Created by famed game designer Phil Walker-Harding


—description from the publisher

Introduction: 
Heat your tires with a good burnout, Stage Your car slowly as you pull up to the starting line, wait for the other driver, amber lights start dropping on the Christmas tree……… yellow……. Yellow……. Yellow……. Green……… full throttle as its time to go….go.…. go.
Hope All is Good and No Major Issues Along the Way to the Finish!
Coming up on the finish, it’s going to be close, cross your fingers and pray the win light comes on. The sport of drag racing is one of the most exciting, entertaining, and fastest past-times in history. Dragstrip Showdown- Roll & Write brings this exciting entertainment to your table top in a quick playing one to two player game.

Overview:
This is a roll and write game using dice and offering fun good decisions to try and cross the finish line first before your competition. Each round, a pool of dice gets rolled and players take turns selecting one die at a time marking the results off on the various player mat tracks which can gain movement, events, and other special actions gained. Players have up to six turns/12 rounds to achieve their goal to enter into the finish zone…sounds easy, as you just hope to get the win light.

This is a partly mechanical, and rather complex, baseball game for two players, boasting a metal playfield inside a wooden frame.

A "hidden" trigger allows the pitcher to fire the ball, while the batter has a spring-loaded bat attached to the frame which can swat at the ball. Indented cups in the board at the various bases and home plate, as well as the outfield, allow the ball to come to rest and the play to be scored.

The game also includes a set of lead baseball player figures which can be moved around to represent the progress of taking bases, and so on.

Duel Arena is a strategic resource management game in a medieval fantasy setting. Each player takes control of a Hero with unique abilities and must travel around the Arena collecting weapons and armour to become stronger. You must carefully manage the use of your items, as well as your Gold and Health. Only by correctly leveraging these resources will you be able to outmaneuver your opponents and claim victory.

—description from the publisher

Join a crew of eye-masked pirates and sail across the seas to find parties and treasure! Face different challenges as you warm up yer paws for this family party game.

Slide your panda pirate meeple from the giant turtle-boat at the center of the Sea board to land on the islands of the Avian Archipielago and gain a coin for landing in the center of an island. After that, pick a Party card to trigger a minigame. The better you play minigames, the more coins you get at the end. Minigames range from different mechanics; from dexterity-based to memory, luck or area movement. Some minigames are free for all, others by teams or even 1-vs-many. Before every minigame, all players try to guess who will win or lose. Correct guesses will earn a coin.

At the end of the round, players move their character in the Treasure Hunt board and try to find a buried chest (Victory points). After 6 rounds, the game ends and players may spend coins to get more chests. The player with the most chests wins!

Join the most festive crew of the seas and participate in challenges of all kinds that will bring you unforgettable memories and friends. Sail along the cheerful crew of Party Panda Pirates!

—description from the publisher

Do you love adventure? Want to save endangered monkeys? Play this entertaining and unusual trick-taking game and join us in the jungle and experience the true story of the Doucs! You will discover what it takes for them to survive.

In Douc In Danger, players take turns being good rangers, nasty poachers or curious tourists, each of whom has different reasons for being in the jungle.

    The Poacher will hunt the DOUCs, putting them in danger. Which in turn puts pressure on the Ranger.
    The Ranger will risk it all to save DOUCs. Each unsaved DOUC is considered lost, and will have a negative effect on end-game scoring.
    The Tourists will choose how they approach the DOUCs. Whether they save the DOUCs or put them in danger lies in their hands!


Before starting each game the players must decide how difficult to make their game, as determined by the 3 Danger Levels. Players may choose a single Danger Level, or they may mix and match Danger Levels in each month of their game.  Each Danger Level adds new mechanisms and strategic depth to the game.

The player with the fewest lost Doucs after the game wins.

Douc In Danger supports projects for the conservation of red-shanked Doucs.

—description from the designer

In August 1945, Japan made an unconditional surrender to the Allied Powers in World War II. At the end of the weary eight-year-long full-scale anti-fascist war, the Chinese Nationalist Party (KMT) and the Communist Party of China (CPC), temporarily united to resist invasion by militaristic Japan, were once again faced with the crisis of breaking up. An outright war that would soon engulf the whole country was about to come.

This strategic-level wargame applies our innovative game system specially designed for the Chinese Civil War. You will play as the Chinese Nationalist Party or the Chinese Communist Party through the civil war between 1945 and 1949. With a unique attack-and-reaction system and area control system, you can experience different tactics such as mobile warfare and guerrilla warfare in the Chinese Civil War, deploying resources across the whole country. With a political simulation and event system, you can also experience the political gambles of both sides in the civil war.

This is a war that will determine the fate of China's future. Should you concentrate your superior forces to destroy the enemy in one move, or reserve your strength by mobile operations? Should you strive to lead your side to a total victory in the war or conduct negotiations to gain an advantage in the coalition government? The choice is up to you.

—description from the designer
Yigo is fast paced word building card game. It is mixture between UNO and scrabble with 7 different action cards that help you build the words. First player to lose all cards wins the game.

A card game where you form inappropriate sentences about your fellow players.
Each player starts with several words chosen at random on cards. Player 1 says their name (or name of someone all players know) and then Player 2 plays a card to get the sentence going followed by Player 3 etc (eg Simon likes to play...).
The object of the game is to keep the sentence going whilst still making sense.
The winner is the first player to get rid of all their cards.

—description from the designer

Five matematical symbols (+ - : x =) and one number card are placed on the table. Each player is dealt 6 number cards. The goal of the game is to get rid of ones cards by using them to form equations by combining them with the card on the table to equal the number card on the table.

If a player can't form an equation, he draws up to 3 cards from the deck. If he still isn't able to form an equation, the next player takes his turn.

The first player to get rid of his cards wins the game.

—user summary

Game to socialize and generate empathy with all the participants. Ideal for teenagers and adults who want to have fun trying to know what the rest of the participants think. The more you know the players, the more chances of winning, and if not, they will have to risk their answers, making the game even more fun.

Ideal for teenagers and adults who want to have fun trying to know what the rest of the participants think.

After reading the question aloud, the rest of the players choose the answer they think is correct, then the answers are read and scored. The winner is the one who guesses the most, showing more empathy with others.

Súper Viaje de Emociones is a game to talk about what happens to us. It contains a board, where the route is a trip that is made with all the participants and the Bigotes Cat as a companion. Upon landing in different boxes, the players raise a card that invites them to express their emotions in different ways. The first to arrive becomes the emotional guide of the game!

The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to pass space 55 wins the game.

Sail ships for this game were included in 500g packages of Rix bread.

The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces the player automatically moves forward or backwards. On some spaces the player may roll again.

The first to reach space 128 wins the game.

The game was published on a sheet of paper.

—user summary
